title: How much control does Spider-Man have over his web shooters? Can Peter Parker construct any shape he can think of with them? - Quora

response.answer_text: Spider-Man’s control over his web shooters has been depicted in varying degrees over the years. Like seriously it’s weird. During his early years, he could essentially create any structure the plot wanted him to. It was like a plot armor for him. (Like how Batman could defeat anyone with prep time no matter how absurd it could be). To back up my points, here are some examples.  Here he creates a shield. And then his web fluid breaks the laws of physics to spin on its own.  Here he makes another shield (this happened in the same page). I think Peter might have created some magic web fluid. No other explanation here.  He creates a parachute here……… Like……What??!!   He created a flying bat here……And a giant spider……. Okay that’s pretty cool. 10 out of 10. He was like the Michaelangelo of Super-heroes.  Well……..Batman’s not gonna like this…….  Well…….. Let’s see Captain America do that right? See the thing is, Super-hero comics were pretty goofy back then. It’s still great to read them, being classic hero tales and all that. But these kinds of absurd stuff won’t work these days. Nowadays Spider-Man can only do basic stuff with his web shooters (Thank God), like normal web shots, web lines and giant webs to trap enemies. So he can swing across Manhattan, and trap enemies with his webs, but he can’t sculpt a web statue of Steve Rogers with Jesus abs. Although I would pay to read that.
